message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: List<String> l=new ArrayList<String>();
l.add("A");
l.add("B");
l.add("C");
l.add("D");
l.add("E");

int n = l.size();
int k = 3;

for (int i = 1; i <= k; i++) {
    Iterator<String> it = l.iterator();
    List<String> tuple = new ArrayList<String>();
    while (it.hasNext()) {
        tuple.add(it.next());
        if (tuple.size() == i) {
            System.out.println(tuple);
            tuple.remove(tuple.size() - 1);
        }
    }
}
  
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses nested loops to generate all k-tuples from a given n-tuple. The outer loop iterates from 1 to k, representing the size of the tuples. The inner loop uses an iterator to iterate over the elements of the n-tuple and adds them to a temporary tuple list. When the size of the temporary tuple list reaches the desired size, it is printed and the last element is removed to generate the next tuple. This process is repeated for each size of the tuples.
